subsection_name: mong-mat.json_6_How are fatty pterygium and pterygium in the eye different?
subsection_content:
Fatty pterygium and pterygium can be identified through the following characteristics [5]:
Pterygium is a white or yellow tumor that appears on the white of the eye. The tumor does not overlap the cornea and does not have any symptoms.; Pterygium is a growth in the size of the conjunctiva, has many blood vessels inside and can spread to the cornea.
